New Records: This was the first time since 1997 that Sri Lanka have defeated India in a bilateral series.
Key Match Events: Dunith Wellalage took 5 wickets as Sri Lanka defeated India by 110 runs.
Rohit Sharma top-scored for India with 35 runs.
Washington Sundar scored 30 runs at the end of the innings.
Riyan Parag took three wickets to help restrict Sri Lanka to 248/7.
Avishka Fernando played a significant innings for Sri Lanka.
Sri Lanka won the 3-match ODI series 2-0.
Wellalage dismissed Kuldeep Yadav to seal the victory for Sri Lanka.
Maheesh Theekshana took the crucial wicket of Washington Sundar.
Jeffrey Vandersay took the wicket of Shivam Dube.
Wellalage dismissed Shreyas Iyer and Axar Patel in quick succession.
Pre-Game Insights: Charith Asalanka mentioned the importance of someone scoring a hundred on the pitch.
Rohit Sharma emphasized the need to address batting and bowling issues as a group.
Rohit Sharma mentioned the inclusion of Rishabh Pant and Riyan Parag in place of KL Rahul and Arshdeep Singh.
Charith Asalanka mentioned the inclusion of Maheesh Theekshana in place of Akila Dananjaya.
Post-Match Reflections: Riyan Parag expressed disappointment about not being able to restrict Sri Lanka to a lower score.
Rohit Sharma expressed disappointment about the loss and emphasized the need to adapt to the conditions.
Rohit Sharma mentioned the need to address batting issues in the middle overs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch was dry with more cracks visible, making it challenging for the batsmen.
Theekshana was involved in a stumping incident where he was not out.
Kusal Mendis scored a half-century for Sri Lanka.
Riyan Parag's bowling was exceptional, getting turn out of the surfaces.
Sri Lanka's strategy of using spin effectively against India.
India's struggles against spin on low, spinning tracks.
The importance of the upcoming ODI series against England for India's preparation for the Champions Trophy.
